info.title: plenigo API v3
info.description:
This is the OpenAPI description for accessing the plenigo platform.
All API calls are by default synchronous. Asynchronous calls are marked.

plenigoToken.name: X-plenigo-token
plenigoToken.description:
To access functions from the public API a valid plenigo token must be provided as header.

```
curl -i -H "X-plenigo-token: PLENIGO_TOKEN" -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://hostname/resource
```

sizeQuery.name: size
sizeQuery.description: amount of elements to return - if no size is provided or the size is not within range it will be automatically set to 5

startTimeQuery.name: startTime
startTimeQuery.description: time the entity was changed after or equal with date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

endTimeQuery.name: endTime
endTimeQuery.description: time the entity was changed before or equal with date-time notation as defined by RFC 3339, section 5.6, for example, 2017-07-21T17:32:28Z

startingAfterQuery.name: startingAfter
startingAfterQuery.description: A cursor for use in pagination. startingAfter is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include startingAfter=obj_foo in order to fetch the next result set.

endingBeforeQuery.name: endingBefore
endingBeforeQuery.description: A cursor for use in pagination. endingBefore is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, starting with obj_bar, your subsequent call can include endingBefore=obj_bar in order to fetch the previous page of the list.

sortQuery.name: sort
sortQuery.description: The sort of the search, if its desc it will revert to search for a lower startingAfter

status.description:
new status the customer should become

| Status      | Description                                                                                                                                               |
| ----------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| ACTIVATED   | customer is active and can log in and use full functionality                                                                                              |
| BLOCKED     | customer is blocked and needs to reset his password to be able to log in again                                                                            |
| DEACTIVATED | customer is deactivated and cannot log in - the customer cannot change this state by himself and a log in attempt is handled like a false password log in |
